thread.title: Telstra's new CEO Andy Penn has big boots to fill
thread.title_full: Telstra's new CEO Andy Penn has big boots to fill

author: John McDuling
title: Telstra's new CEO Andy Penn has big boots to fill
text:
New Telstra CEO Andy Penn (right) and his predecessor David Thodey (left). Photo: Cole Bennetts
Telstra's new CEO Andy Penn is making his first public appearance of significance today since taking the reins at the telecom giant in May.
He's delivering a speech in Sydney and although nothing major is expected, it's still Penn's first chance to step out of the shadow of his illustrious predecessor. David Thodey engineered a stunning turnaround at Telstra , extending its dominant position in the mobile sector, negotiating lucrative agreements with the government (twice) over the National Broadband Network, selling off non-core assets and cutting expenses. The share price nearly doubled on his watch.
So he'll be a hard act to follow. That said, Penn is about the best qualified person on the planet to continue Telstra's sharemarket run. Before taking the top, job he spent 3 1/2 years as the company's chief beancounter, and before that he was the CEO of Axa-Asia Pacific Holdings, which was sold to AMP in 2011 for $4 billion.
